business.headline: Gold, silver or Bitcoin? Will crypto steal the spotlightGold and silver have long been seen as safe havens for investors, a reliable store of value in uncertain times. But with the rise of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, the question on everyone's mind is: could cryptos steal the spotlight?

Pace and ease of doing business drive Tamil Nadu's edge, says TRB RajaaRajaa said that investors value policy continuity as much as fresh reforms, noting that Tamil Nadu has built trust by maintaining stable, industry-friendly rules across political regimes. He added that this continuity has strengthened global investor confidence in the state.

AI is disrupting more than just tech and IT stocks. What investors should knowThe panic around AI is now spreading across Wall Street, moving beyond tech to hit wealth management stocks as well. In this article, we break down what's happening and what retail investors should know.

From SBI, PNB to Suryoday Small Finance Bank: A look at latest FD rates across banksInterest rates vary widely depending on how long the money is locked in. In many cases, three-year and five-year deposits offer better returns than shorter tenures. At the same time, depositors should balance higher rates with factors such as bank safety, liquidity needs and their own financial goals.

Sensex, Nifty pause 3-day rally as IT stocks limit gains on D-StreetSensex, Nifty closed lower. Both indices had gained nearly 1.2% in the previous three sessions. The rally was driven by hopes around a possible U.S.-India trade deal.

Ease and speed of doing business put Tamil Nadu on top, says TRB RajaaRajaa said Tamil Nadu's unique strength lies in being India's talent capital, adding that the state produces around 150,000 engineers and benefits from a strong talent pool built through heavy investment in education.

This Mumbai society pays nearly Rs 3 lakh to residents to live thereInstead of charging monthly maintenance, the society is said to distribute nearly Rs 2.5 lakh to Rs 3 lakh annually to each homeowner.

Why 2026 might be the best time in years to buy a house in IndiaAre affordable housing, sustainable living and the rise of Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities redefining India's property landscape in 2026? Let's have a look.

How much debt does India have?According to the Receipt Budget 2026–27, the outstanding internal and external debt and other liabilities of the Government of India are estimated at Rs 214 lakh crore at the end of March 2027.

Have Rs 30,000 to invest? Edelweiss MF's Radhika Gupta shares smart money tipsWith markets swinging and investors feeling unsure, many people are wondering where to put their money. Edelweiss Mutual Fund CEO Radhika Gupta has shared simple and practical advice for those trying to make smarter investment decisions.

No tax refund even after 90 days? Here's the reason behind the delayMany taxpayers expecting quick refunds are finding themselves stuck in a long wait. With several income tax returns pending for over 90 days, concerns are growing about delays and what they mean for ordinary filers.

Why awareness is the only antidote to mis-selling in insuranceAs India's insurance ecosystem continues to scale, the responsibility of protection must be shared, insurers must simplify, platforms must guide transparently, and consumers must engage with curiosity and awareness.
Sensex, Nifty open in green as investor sentiment improves renewed FII buyingThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 71.22 points to 84,345.14, while the NSE Nifty50 added 44.90 points to 25,980.05 as of 9:28 am.

Journalist Ravi Nair sentenced to one year in jail in Adani defamation caseAdani Enterprises had filed a private complaint under Section 500 of the Indian Penal Code, alleging that Nair published defamatory tweets and online articles that harmed the company's reputation.

Day after releasing India-US deal factsheet, White House quietly revises key termsThe US has revised its India-US trade deal factsheet, softening language from India "commits" to "intends" to buy $500 billion in US goods and removing references to certain agricultural items and digital services tax.

Will higher STT on F&O curb speculative trading or just hurt investors?Whether the STT hike proves a safety measure or a misfire will depend on how traders respond. Supporters see discipline; critics fear distortion. In this article, we break down both arguments and what they mean for investors.
Sensex ends 208 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; Eternal gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 208.17 points to close at 84,273.92, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 67.85 points to end at 25,935.15.

Sukanya Samriddhi vs equity: Where should you invest for your daughter's future?Investing for your daughter is not just about saving money, it is about choosing the right balance between safety and growth. Sukanya Samriddhi and equities represent two very different strategies, and understanding them can help you make a smarter decision.

India's insurance mis-selling problem may finally get a commission fixRegulators and industry experts point to the existing commission structure as a key reason behind insurance mis-selling. Under the current system, insurance agents earn a large share of their commission in the first year of a policy.

EPFO plans instant UPI withdrawals: Launch timeline, claim time and key detailsGetting your EPF money may soon become much faster. EPFO plans to roll out a new UPI-enabled app that could allow near-instant withdrawals. Here's what we know so far about the launch schedule and claim timelines.

entertainment.headline: Rupali Ganguly admits getting a glimpse of Dhurandhar 2. Check her reaction Rupali Ganguly shared her thoughts on the upcoming sequel, Dhurandhar: The Revenge. The actor recalled her experience with the first film and revealed what she thought about bits and pieces of the Ranveer Singh starrer.

The actor commented on the monologue being conveniently used in Parliament, while he faced criticism when he originally delivered the act.

Farah Khan celebrates triplets' 18th birthday: Happy memories are best inheritance Farah Khan celebrated her triplets Czar, Diva, and Anya turning 18 with a heartfelt social media post, calling happy memories the greatest inheritance for children.

The Hunting Party Season 2 review: When serial killers escape, the hunt gets brutalRelease Date:Sun Aug 02, 2026 A secret prison, escaped serial killers and a profiler pushed to her limits, The Hunting Party Season 2 sharpens its thrills and psychological edge. Is it worth the binge?

Halle Berry on being age-shamed for Crime 101: Women are not done at 50, 60 or 70 Halle Berry spoke about age-shaming in the entertainment industry, urging women to reclaim their power after fifty. She highlighted the need for a shift in how society views ageing women.

Sreeleela is now a doctor as she completes MBBS. Graduation video goes viral Actor Sreeleela has completed her MBBS degree, marking a significant milestone as she manages a demanding film career and medical studies. Several images from the graduation ceremony have emerged online.

Guru Randhawa aids Rajpal Yadav with financial support Singer Guru Randhawa is the latest celebrity to extend his support to Rajpal Yadav, who is currently in Tihar Jail over a cheque bounce case. Randhawa shared that he hasoffered a music video to the actor.

Brad Pitt's F1 to return with sequel? Producer Jerry Bruckheimer breaks silence Brad Pitt's F1 could be heading back to the track, with producer Jerry Bruckheimer hinting at a sequel. Here's what he said during the annual Academy Awards luncheon in Los Angeles.

Bandwaale trailer: Shalini Pandey leads musical tale of dreams and friendship Musical dramedy Bandwaale unveiled its trailer, introducing a story about small-town dreamers who turn to music and poetry to shape their future.

O'Romeo advance booking Day 1: Here's how much Shahid Kapoor's film has earned Advance booking for Vishal Bhardwaj's O'Romeo opened on February 10.  The film's promising start hints at strong audience interest ahead of its February 13 release.

Rajpal Yadav's bail hearing tomorrow; manager says Salman, Ajay stepping in to help Rajpal Yadav's bail hearing is scheduled for February 12 as he serves a jail term in a cheque-bounce case. His manager has claimed Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn, Varun Dhawan and others from the industry are extending financial support.
When Anupam Kher met Kajal Aggarwal after a long time: So sure of herself Anupam Kher's chance flight reunion with Kajal Aggarwal sparks nostalgia. What did he call her 'real' for?

Ananya Panday calls Farah Khan bestie as she serves Yakhni Pulao in BTS video Ananya Panday shared a fun behind-the-scenes video of Farah Khan serving her Yakhni pulao, showcasing their warm friendship. The post also sparked buzz around the possible return of Call Me Bae Season 2.

Allu Arjun's 42 rules: Pushpa co-star Rajsekhar Aningi calls it completely false Pushpa 2 actor Rajasekhar Aningi defended Allu Arjun against allegations of enforcing a strict set of on-set rules. He called the rumours false and praised the actor's respectful behaviour.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui extends financial aid to Rajpal Yadav again, amid jail crisis Nawazuddin Siddiqui has quietly stepped in to support Rajpal Yadav during his legal crisis, a source revealed. Preferring to help discreetly, the actor previously provided financial aid, reflecting a deep-rooted friendship and collective responsibility within the industry.

Yuvika Chaudhary on The 50: Leaving daughter behind will be an everyday test Yuvika Chaudhary returned to reality TV with The 50 alongside her husband, Prince Narula. The actor opened up about the emotional challenge of leaving their daughter behind while competing in a tough physical contest.

Rajpal Yadav gave Bollywood nearly 3 decades. Will the industry show up for him? After Sonu Sood urged Bollywood to support Rajpal Yadav during his six-month jail term in a cheque-bounce case, only a few actors stepped forward. Many of Yadav's frequent collaborators remain silent. As the film industry debates solidarity, the question emerges: Will Bollywood stand by one of its own?

Arijit Singh's retirement left us stunned, says filmmaker Joe Rajan Director Joe Rajan shared his surprise over Arijit Singh's sudden retirement announcement while recalling their memorable collaboration on the romantic track Tere Sang. He praised Arijit's simplicity, kindness, and selective approach to music, expressing hope that the singer might return.

Did Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau just give us the cutest winter photo dump? Pop star Katy Perry drops a cosy winter album with former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, and fans are reading between the snowy lines.

general news.headline: Met Epstein 3-4 times on peace delegation: Hardeep Puri hits back at Rahul GandhiHardeep Singh Puri, while rubbishing Rahul Gandhi's Epstein link charges, said he met Epstein 3-4 times as part of a delegation and had nothing to do with the charges against the late sex offender.

The reference was to Pakistan's support of the US in its wars. What he doesn't mention is how Islamabad's Kashmir obsession actually brought its ruin.

Afghanistan were on the verge of scripting history, needing two runs to win off the last three balls, chasing 188.

What are the changes? What does it indicate? We break down the issue for you.

Love triangle turns fatal, 19-year-old girl shot dead in MumbaiDuring initial questioning, police said the crime was linked to a love triangle and ongoing personal disputes. According to officials, tensions had been brewing between the victim and the accused for some time.

Calendar entries and logistical messages included in the records show continued coordination around meeting times.

1 killed, 2 hurt in Thai school shooting; hostages rescued as teen gunman arrestedThe perpetrator has been identified as an 18-year-old man. The incident took place in Hat Yai district of Thailand's Songkhla province.

From Pichai to Dario, everyone is coming to India AI Summit but why? Because dhandhoNext week Delhi will see arguably the biggest gathering of tech leaders ever seen. From Google's Sundar Pichai to Anthropic's Dario, everyone is coming for the India AI Impact Summit. But why? It's all about dhandho aka business.

3 last-minute factors that could decide Bangladesh polls, flip script for JamaatA big chunk of undecided voters can swing the Bangladesh election tomorrow any which way. Then there is the likelihood of a low turnout and low participation of women and the elderly in a poll that could be marred by violence. Here's how three election-day factors could help the Jamaat-e-Islami or the BNP.

Why Iran is using dirt at nuclear facilities on Islamic Revolution anniversaryTehran on Wednesday marked the anniversary of the 1979 Iranian Revolution that ushered in the Ayatollah regime. However, the celebrations this year came amid the shadow of an armed conflict with the US. That fear is making Iran use dirt to fortify its nuclear facilities in Isfahan.

Bengal cops search UP home for accused in Mahua Moitra fake chat case, find no oneA West Bengal Police team reached a residential society in Noida to arrest an accused in the viral fake chats case involving TMC MP Mahua Moitra, executing a non-bailable warrant issued by a Nadia court. However, despite conducting a raid and searches, the accused was not found.

The silence of Damdami Mai: How the campus ritual endedOnce a loud Valentine's Day spectacle at the Hindu College, Delhi University, the Virgin Tree ritual was part folklore, part flashpoint. Years after the chants faded, the tree stands bare but the debates it sparked still echo across campus. This is a ground report on how a tradition was defended, dismantled, and ultimately outgrown.

Live: Nirmala Sitharaman rejects Opposition's 'no bullet train for UP' claimParliament Session Live Updates: In a combative intervention during the Budget debate, Rahul Gandhi accused the government of ignoring what he called the "weaponisation of finance and energy" in an increasingly volatile world order. Citing the Economic Survey, he argued that global stability is eroding and that geopolitical conflict is intensifying, with US dominance being challenged by Russia, China and India. Referring to Donald Trump's recent remarks on Russian oil, Gandhi warned that India's energy choices could be dictated from Washington, saying, "You've weaponized energy and you don't have any solutions to overcome this." Stay with IndiaToday.in for the latest and live updates-

sports.headline: ENG vs WI Live Score: England bowl in Mumbai, Jamie Overton replaces Luke Wood ENG (England) vs WI (West Indies) Live Score, T20 World Cup: England have won the toss and opted to bowl first in Mumbai. Jamie Overton has replaced Luke Wood. West Indies have brought in Roston Chase for Matthew Forde.

Abhishek Sharma out of hospital, call on availability for Namibia game on matchday T20 World Cup 2026: India opener Abhishek Sharma has been discharged from a Delhi hospital after being treated for a stomach-related illness. A decision on his availability for Thursday's match against Namibia in Delhi will be taken on matchday.

Namibia captain questions ICC for no night training in Delhi T20 World Cup: Gerhard Erasmus questions scheduling after Namibia were denied a night training session, while India trained twice under lights ahead of their clash in New Delhi.

Cricket sucks, will give Rabada some space: Rickelton AFG vs SA: South Africa batter Ryan Rickelton joked that cricket sucks after the team's double super over thriller against Afghanistan. Steve Smith rushed in as cover as Australia reel from massive injury blow T20 World Cup: AUS vs IRE: Australia have called up Steve Smith as cover after injury to Mitchell Marsh. Smith recently hit the joint second-fastest hundred in the history of the Big Bash League.

SA vs AFG: Super Over(s) heartbreak leaves Afghanistan in danger of early exit T20 World Cup 2026: Afghanistan were pushed to the brink of an early exit from the T20 World Cup as they suffered defeat in a Super Over thriller against South Africa on Wednesday, February 11.

AUS vs IRE Live: Australia start campaign with 67-run win Australia (AUS) vs Ireland (IRE), T20 World Cup live cricket score from Colombo: Australia have beaten Ireland by 67 runs to make a winning start in the tournament. Adam Zampa and Nathan Ellis picked up four wickets apiece.

Is Usman Tariq chucking? Pakistan spinner's unique action creates a stir ICC T20 World Cup: Does Usman Tariq chuck the ball? The question has been floated quite a few times over the last couple of months. In the latest iteration of the debate, former India cricketers Ravichandran Ashwin and Shreevats Goswami engaged in a heated debate on social media over the spinner's action.

Ben Stokes pokes fun at himself with hilarious update following eye surgery England Test captain Ben Stokes remains in good spirits following surgery after a training injury, taking responsibility for the incident and reassuring the young player involved.

Bangladesh sports advisor rewrites World Cup boycott narrative, blames players Sports Advisor Asif Nazrul claimed Bangladesh's T20 World Cup withdrawal was a player and board-led move to protect national dignity. Bangladesh had earlier refused to travel to India, citing directives from their interim government.

India vs Pakistan hype played down by Sahibzada Farhan: It's a normal matchT20 World Cup 2026: Ahead of the India vs Pakistan clash on February 15, Sahibzada Farhan has played down the hype surrounding the rivalry. The Pakistan opener also claimed that the match on Sunday won't be one-sided after their second win of the tournament.

SA vs AFG Highlights: AFG (19/2), lose 2nd Super by whisker in AhmedabadSouth Africa (SA) vs Afghanistan (AFG) Highlights, T20 World Cup: AFG (19/2 in 6 balls). Keshav Maharaj holds his nerve in the 2nd Super Over. After being hit for 3 sixes, he manages to dismiss Gurbaz in the last ball of the 2nd Super Over. South Africa win, and Afghanistan have been pushed to the brink of elimination in the World Cup.

Tangled in green: How Pakistan's spin cycle could trap India in big rivals clashT20 World Cup: Pakistan's spin attack has found its perfect stage in Colombo. With five wicket-takers and India's batters struggling on spicy tracks, the rivals might finally have a weapon that could do some damage.

Pak's Usman Tariq finds support in Ashwin amid claims of illegal bowling actionR Ashwin has jumped to the defence of Pakistan's Usman Tariq amid claims of illegal bowling action following the game against the USA on Monday, February 10.

India have beaten Pakistan eight times in the last 10 matches in all formats.

Matchday Preview: Australia's campaign begins, England and WI collide in MumbaiT20 World Cup 2026, Matchday preview: Three exciting matches are scheduled for February 11 in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026. Australia will begin their campaign against Ireland, while South Africa will take on Afghanistan in the second game. The third fixture will have England and West Indies going up against each other.

Pakistan will play positive, attacking cricket against India: Sahibzada FarhanPakistan opener Sahibzada Farhan has vowed that his side will stick to a positive and attacking brand of cricket in their high-profile T20 World Cup clash against India on February 15.

T20 World Cup: Usman Tariq spins a web over USA as Pakistan complete revengeT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan exact revenge on USA with a dominant 32-run victory in Colombo, settling a significant score from the 2024 T20 World Cup. A complete spin masterclass saw Tariq, Khan, and Ahmad stifle the American batters.

ICC backed off, not Pak, ex-PCB chief claims on U-turn over India matchFormer Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Najam Sethi has made a strong claim over the recent U-turn in the T20 World Cup standoff, asserting that it was the International Cricket Council that stepped back, not Pakistan.

Pakistan no longer dependent on ICC, we earn more from PSL: Najam SethiFormer Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chairman Najam Sethi has said that their cricketing board is no longer dependent on the ICC funding for its sustenance and earns more through their domestic T20 league, Pakistan Super League (PSL).  Sethi also shared his views on the recent meeting of PCB, ICC and the BCB and claimed that the ICC had to accede to Pakistan's demands to save the India vs Pakistan fixture.

Pak had no personal interest in ICC talks: Mohsin Naqvi refutes rejection claimsPakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chairman Mohsin Naqvi on Tuesday said the initial decision to boycott the T20 World Cup fixture against India was taken solely to secure "respect" for Bangladesh, asserting that Pakistan had "no personal interest" in escalating the matter.

Babar Azam silences critics, scores fluent 32-ball 46 against USA in ColomboBabar Azam bounced back with a strong 46-run innings against USA in the T20 World Cup 2026. His performance, supported by Sahibzada Farhan and Shadab Khan, helped Pakistan post a competitive total, while USA's Shadley van Schalkwyk shone with four wickets.

T20 World Cup: When Bas de Leede, for a moment, became Virat KohliBas de Leede played a match-winning unbeaten 72 as the Netherlands defeated Namibia in the T20 World Cup. His powerful six and the team's extensive training in India highlight their growing competitiveness at the tournament.

Ahishek Sharma misses training, Sanju Samson sweats it out in DelhiT20 World Cup 2026: Star opener Abhishek Sharma missed India's training session at Arun Jaitley Stadium on Tuesday. Sanju Samson and Ishan Kishan batted in pairs for close to an hour under the lights.

Pak's boycott drama: How tales of monkey and jackal expose Paper Tiger's blusterPakistan's dramatic U-turn on boycotting the India T20 clash mirrors tales of a meddling monkey, fasting fool, and fading blue jackal, revealing a tamasha that amused nobody other than Shehbaz Sharif.

Allen, Seifert annihilate UAE, guide New Zealand to dominant 10-wicket winNew Zealand dominated UAE by 10 wickets in the T20 World Cup 2026 at Chennai. Their record opening partnership set a new benchmark and strengthened their position atop Group D.

India coach breaks silence on Pak's boycott U-turn: Game on until told otherwiseT20 World Cup 2026: India's assistant coach, Ryan ten Doeschate revealed how the Indian team reacted upon learning that Pakistan would indeed face them in Colombo on February 15.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
